name: the most sacred
description:
In August 2021, the International Indigenous Youth Council in the Twin Cities led a rally in Saint Paul, MN to demand JPMorgan Chase end financing to Enbridge and their Line 3 tar sands pipeline replacement project. Since 2016, the bank has provided $1.8 billion in financing to Enbridge. When in operation, Line 3 will transport 760,000 barrels of carbon-intensive tar sands oil per day from Edmonton, Alberta, through Minnesota, to Superior, Wisconsin.

A report by the Rainforest Action Network and Sierra Club found that 60 of the largest banks in the world have financed $3.8 trillion in fossil fuels in the five years since the Paris climate agreement was signed in 2016.
